docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 26 -- Argentine exiles here believe the Navy has not submitted to the Government of President Juan D. Peron. They say it is holding out for a settlement that will achieve some of the aims of the June 16 revolt.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 26 -- Argentine exiles here believe the Navy has not submitted to the Government of President Juan D. Peron. They say it is holding out for a settlement that will achieve some of the aims of the June 16 revolt.
docs.abstract: exiles in Montevideo see Navy holding out for settlement that will achieve some of revolt's aims; hold Olivieri escaped from BA just before revolt collapsed; Uruguayan sources rept their air patrols have identified at least 9 Argentine warships at sea; Argentine press silent on fleet; services held in ruins of 2 burned-out chs, BA; 115 Caths arrested June 12 freed; Dem and Socialist leaders freed

headline.main: EXILES SEE NAVY DEFIANT OF PERON; Montevideo Group Feels Fleet Has Not Yielded and Seeks to Win Some Revolt Aims

byline.original: By SAM POPE BREWERSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: British sterling capped an irregularly lower trend for most of last week by a precipitate decline on Friday. Heavy selling on a market virtually barren of buying orders caused a plunge to $2.78-7/32, lowest since late February, with the day's close...
docs.lead_paragraph: British sterling capped an irregularly lower trend for most of last week by a precipitate decline on Friday. Heavy selling on a market virtually barren of buying orders caused a plunge to $2.78-7/32, lowest since late February, with the day's close of $2.78-13/32, a loss of 9/16 cent from the preceding week.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; Week Ended June 24, 1955

docs.snippet: MADISON, Wis., June 26 (UP) -- Patty Berg, a pro golfer for fifteen years, won a fifth women's Western Open championship today. She registered a par 73 to gain the title by two strokes with a seventy-two-hole total of 292, even par for the distance.
docs.lead_paragraph: MADISON, Wis., June 26 (UP) -- Patty Berg, a pro golfer for fifteen years, won a fifth women's Western Open championship today. She registered a par 73 to gain the title by two strokes with a seventy-two-hole total of 292, even par for the distance.

headline.main: PATTY BERG GAINS TITLE FIFTH TIME; With 73 for 292, She Takes Western Open by 2 Shots Over Madison Links

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., June 30 -- The United States is facing increasing competition in Latin American markets from the Soviet Union and nations of the Soviet bloc, a United Nations agency reported today.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., June 30 -- The United States is facing increasing competition in Latin American markets from the Soviet Union and nations of the Soviet bloc, a United Nations agency reported today.
docs.abstract: UN survey shows vol up from nearly O to 1.6%, '52-54; strong bloc drive for new mkts linked; rising competition for US seen

headline.main: RED TRADE RISING IN LATIN AMERICA; U. S. Goods Meeting More Competition, Commission Tells U. N. Agency RED TRADE RISING IN LATIN AMERICA

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: WICHITA, Kan., June 30 (AP) -- Fay Crocker of Montevideo, Uruguay, shot a two-over-par 74 today to take the first-round lead in the $7,500 women's National Open golf tournament.
docs.lead_paragraph: WICHITA, Kan., June 30 (AP) -- Fay Crocker of Montevideo, Uruguay, shot a two-over-par 74 today to take the first-round lead in the $7,500 women's National Open golf tournament.

headline.main: Miss Crocker Leads in Women's Golf; URUGUAY PLAYER HAS 2-OVER-PAR 74 Miss Crocker Paces Field in National Open After First Round -- Miss Yates Next

docs.snippet: SAO PAULO, Brazil, June 30 (UP) -- Fernand Leger, French artist, won today the $4,000 grand international prize of the third biennial Modern Art Exposition here.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAO PAULO, Brazil, June 30 (UP) -- Fernand Leger, French artist, won today the $4,000 grand international prize of the third biennial Modern Art Exposition here.
docs.abstract: opening set; awards; $4,000 grand prize to F Leger (France)

headline.main: $4,000 Modern Art Prize Is Awarded to Leger

keywords.value: SAO PAULO (BRAZIL) MODERN ART MUSEUM INTERNATL BIENNIAL

docs.snippet: WICHITA, Kan., July 1 (AP) -- Fay Crocker of Montevideo, Uruguay, today fired an even-par 72 to increase her lead at the halfway point in the women's national open golf tournament to eight strokes.
docs.lead_paragraph: WICHITA, Kan., July 1 (AP) -- Fay Crocker of Montevideo, Uruguay, today fired an even-par 72 to increase her lead at the halfway point in the women's national open golf tournament to eight strokes.

headline.main: 8-SHOT LEAD GOES TO MISS CROCKER; Uruguayan Cards 72 for 146 in U. S. Women's Open Golf -- Miss Faulk Second

docs.snippet: WICHITA, Kan., July 2 -- Fay Crocker of Montevideo, Uruguay, staved off sharp challenges by Mary Lena Faulk and Louise Suggs to win the $7,500 women's National Open golf championship today. She carded 299 and Miss Faulk and Miss Suggs finished with...
docs.lead_paragraph: WICHITA, Kan., July 2 -- Fay Crocker of Montevideo, Uruguay, staved off sharp challenges by Mary Lena Faulk and Louise Suggs to win the $7,500 women's National Open golf championship today. She carded 299 and Miss Faulk and Miss Suggs finished with 303's.

headline.main: FAY CROCKER'S 299 BEST BY 4 STROKES; Miss Faulk and Miss Suggs Score 303's as National Open at Wichita Ends
